item.title: England Tour, Australia Revenge, New Zealand Away: India's Full Schedule For WTC 2025-27 - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India's Schedule for World Test Championship 2025-27 Revealed

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Sports

The Indian cricket team is preparing for the upcoming World Test Championship cycle from 2025-27, starting with a challenging tour of England.

  • June 2025: India will tour England for a five-match Test series.
  • October 2025: India will host two Test matches against the West Indies.
  • December 2025: South Africa will visit India for two Tests.
  • August 2026: India will tour Sri Lanka for two Tests.
  • October-December 2026: India will tour New Zealand for two Tests.
  • January-February 2027: Australia will visit India for a five-match Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
“The cycle could also signal the end of some glittering Test careers.”

As the 2025-27 cycle unfolds, the leadership of coach Gautam Gambhir is under scrutiny as he seeks to guide India toward success in the World Test Championship.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah To Skip Majority Of England Series, Grade Of Injury Yet To Be Ascertained: Report

Date: January 06, 2025 18:17 IST Source: News18

Jasprit Bumrah sustained back spasms during the fifth Test against Australia, resulting in a likely absence from most of the upcoming series against England. The extent of his injury is still undetermined.

  • Bumrah experienced back spasms and did not bowl in the second innings of the fifth Test.
  • The BCCI plans to rest him to ensure his availability for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy.
  • The severity of his injury is not yet known, with possible grades affecting recovery time from 2-3 weeks to up to 3 months.
  • He may miss the entire T20I series and possibly some ODIs.
“The fresh blow has renewed focus on Bumrah’s workload and the Indian team’s overdependence on him.”

The implications of Bumrah's injury are significant for the Indian cricket team as they prepare for the Champions Trophy.

item.title: "If He Was From Tamil Nadu, Would've Been Dropped": Selection Bias Hinted Over Misfiring India Star .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
If He Was From Tamil Nadu, Would've Been Dropped: Selection Bias Hinted Over Misfiring India Star In Australia Tour

Publication Date: September 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

Shubman Gill's disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy has sparked criticism and raised questions about selection bias in Indian cricket.

  • Shubman Gill missed the first Test due to injury and had lackluster performances in the following matches.
  • He scored only 93 runs across three Tests, with a top score of 31.
  • Former player Subramaniam Badrinath suggested that had Gill been from Tamil Nadu, he would have been dropped from the team.
  • Badrinath criticized Gill's lack of intent and his poor performance on the field, calling him a liability.
“If this was Shubman Gill from Tamil Nadu, he would have been dropped.” - Subramaniam Badrinath

The discussion surrounding Shubman Gill's selection highlights ongoing debates about regional biases and performance expectations in Indian cricket.

item.title: ‘Could be only one winner’: Johnson lambasts Sam Konstas for enabling India and Bumrah's ‘two against 11’ mindset - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Johnson Criticizes Sam Konstas for Provoking Bumrah During Sydney Test

Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mitchell Johnson criticizes Sam Konstas for his inexperience shown during an altercation with Jasprit Bumrah in the Sydney Test. The Australian pacer reflects on the implications of this incident in the context of the match.

  • Johnson believes Konstas acted rashly by provoking Bumrah, showing a lack of experience.
  • Australia won the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 3-1, but the focus has shifted to the incident involving Konstas and Bumrah.
  • Bumrah confronted Konstas after taking a wicket, escalating tensions on the field.
  • Gautam Gambhir, India’s head coach, defended Bumrah, stating that cricket is about being tough.
  • Johnson argued that there could only be one winner in such confrontations between bowlers and batsmen.
“I appreciate what Konstas was trying to do by supporting his teammate, but it was simply the wrong time for that kind of engagement.” - Mitchell Johnson

Johnson concludes that the incident highlights the learning curve for younger players like Konstas and reflects on the competitive nature of international cricket.

item.title: Watch: 12-Year-Old Sushila Meena, Who Impressed Sachin Tendulkar, Clean Bowls Rajyavardhan Rathore - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: 12-Year-Old Sushila Meena, Who Impressed Sachin Tendulkar, Clean Bowls Rajyavardhan Rathore

Publication Date: January 6, 2025
Source: NDTV

Sushila Meena, a 12-year-old talent from Rajasthan, has caught the attention of cricket legends after impressively bowling out sports minister Rajyavardhan Rathore. Her journey to fame began after Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of her bowling.

  • Sushila’s bowling action resembles that of former Indian cricketer Zaheer Khan.
  • Rathore missed the ball and got clean bowled during their practice match.
  • Sushila, from a small village, has been playing cricket for three years.
  • Her coach supports her training despite limited facilities.
“Bitiya se clean bowled hokar hum sab jeet gaye.” — Col Rajyavardhan Rathore

Sushila's father expressed gratitude towards Sachin Tendulkar for making his daughter viral on social media.

This remarkable story showcases the potential of young athletes and the impact of social media in recognizing talent.

item.title: Christian comes out of retirement to help injury-hit Thunder - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Dan Christian Returns from Retirement to Aid Sydney Thunder

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australian T20 legend Dan Christian comes out of retirement to help the injury-affected Sydney Thunder in the Big Bash League (BBL).

The 41-year-old allrounder last played in BBL12 for Sydney Sixers and has been an assistant coach at Thunder. He is stepping in due to significant injuries within the team.

  • Christian joins an elite club of players in their 40s playing in the BBL.
  • Thunder has been affected by injuries to key players including Sams and Bancroft.
  • Christian has been active with UNSW in the NSW Premier Cricket competition to stay fit.
  • Trent Copeland, Thunder's general manager, expresses confidence in Christian's abilities.
"I made the decision during the off season that a return to the BBL or any other T20 leagues was never entirely off the table for me." - Dan Christian

Christian has played over 400 T20 games and is a seasoned player in various countries.

His return is not only a boost for the team but also a significant moment for his career and the BBL.

item.title: 'We’ll be back stronger': Yashasvi Jaiswal sets sights on comeback after India’s defeat in Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
'We’ll be back stronger': Yashasvi Jaiswal sets sights on comeback after India’s defeat in Australia

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Times of India

Yashasvi Jaiswal showcases determination for India's resurgence after their defeat in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series to Australia 1-3.
  • This defeat is India's first Test series loss to Australia in ten years.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was outstanding, taking the most wickets in the series with a total of 32.
  • Jaiswal achieved 391 runs in the series, including one century and two half-centuries.
  • Despite individual successes, Jaiswal expressed disappointment over the team's overall performance.
“I learnt a lot in Australia… Unfortunately, the result wasn’t what we had hoped for, but we’ll be back stronger. Your support means everything.” - Yashasvi Jaiswal

Australian opener Usman Khawaja and former England captain Michael Vaughan praised Jaiswal's talent, emphasizing his potential for the future.

The future looks hopeful as Jaiswal and his counterparts are eager to improve and achieve greater success for India.

item.title: "The way he got out in South Africa, I doubted whether he would be able to score runs in Australia": Sunil Gavaskar hails Indian player for proving him wrong - Crictoday
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Praises Yashasvi Jaiswal's Performance in Australia

Published on: 2024-25 by Crictoday

Former India player Sunil Gavaskar has hailed Yashasvi Jaiswal for his performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy (BGT) 2024-25. Initially doubting Jaiswal's ability to perform in Australia after struggles in South Africa, Gavaskar now praises the young batter for his impressive run in the series.

  • India faced a 1-3 defeat in the five-match series against Australia.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 391 runs at an average of 43.44 in 10 innings.
  • Gavaskar noted Jaiswal's improvement and commitment to refining his batting techniques throughout the tournament.
  • In the Perth match, Jaiswal scored 161 runs in the second innings, contributing significantly to India's win.
“He improved as a batter after making mistakes. I was not confident of his success after watching him fail in South Africa on similar pitches,” Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar's insights reflect not only on Jaiswal's talent but also on the potential for growth after challenges, highlighting a bright future for the young cricketer.

item.title: 'Taking it a little bit too far': Brad Hogg criticises Australian coach over remarks on India's 'intimida - The Times of India
item.description:
Taking it a little bit too far: Brad Hogg criticises Australian coach over remarks on India's 'intimidation' of Sam Konstas

Published on: [Date not provided] Source: Times of India

Brad Hogg has voiced strong criticism against the Australian coach for comments regarding India's perceived 'intimidation' tactics towards player Sam Konstas.

  • Hogg believes the comments were excessive and not warranted.
  • He remarks on the importance of sportsmanship in cricket.
  • The controversy arises amidst ongoing matches between Australia and India.
“It’s taking it a little bit too far,” said Hogg regarding the coach's remarks.

This situation brings to light the ongoing tension in cricketing rivalries and the expectations of conduct on and off the field.

item.title: Australia, England and India in favour of splitting Test cricket into two divisions - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Australia, England and India in favour of splitting Test cricket into two divisions

Publication Date: Jan 6, 2025

Source: The Age

Cricket powerhouses Australia, India, and England are contemplating a move to split Test playing teams into two divisions, aiming for more matches among the 'Big Three'.

  • The chairs of Cricket Australia and the England Cricket Board will meet with ICC chair Jay Shah later this month.
  • Implementing two divisions would see India, Australia, and England playing more frequently against each other.
  • Record attendance was seen during the recent Border-Gavaskar Test series in Australia.
  • 12 Test playing teams currently exist, with varied match frequencies among them.
  • The change would not take effect until mid-2027 due to existing schedules.
  • Ravi Shastri, former India player and coach, supports the proposal.
  • The concept was initially proposed in 2016, facing opposition from several cricket boards.
  • The potential division might include South Africa, Australia, England, India, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, and Pakistan in the top tier, while West Indies, Bangladesh, Ireland, Afghanistan, and Zimbabwe would be in the second division.
  • Concerns exist that this move could diminish television and sponsorship revenues for lower-ranked teams.
“If you want Test cricket to survive and be alive and thriving, I think that’s the way to go.” - Ravi Shastri

The potential for splitting Test cricket into two divisions represents a significant shift in the sport, aiming to enhance competition and ensure the survival of Test cricket amidst various challenges.

item.title: Harbhajan Singh's Epic Rahul Dravid Remark In Subtle Dig At Gautam Gambhir - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Harbhajan Singh's Epic Rahul Dravid Remark In Subtle Dig At Gautam Gambhir

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The article discusses former cricketer Harbhajan Singh's comments on the performances of the Indian cricket team under coach Gautam Gambhir, highlighting concerns over recent series losses.

  • Gautam Gambhir's coaching career starts with multiple defeats, including a series loss to Sri Lanka and a 1-3 defeat against Australia.
  • Harbhajan Singh questions the team's downfall post-Rahul Dravid's tenure as coach.
  • Calls for addressing the 'superstar' culture in Indian cricket are emphasized, urging selectors to focus on current performance over reputation.
  • Concern over consistent performers like Abhimanyu Easwaran and Sarfaraz Khan not getting playtime during the Australia tour.
“Every player has a reputation... India should leave behind the superstar attitude.” - Harbhajan Singh

In conclusion, Harbhajan Singh emphasizes the need for selectors to make tough decisions regarding team composition based on performance rather than favoritism.

item.title: India vs England ODI and T20 full schedule, squads and live streaming - Business Standard
item.description:
India vs England ODI and T20 Full Schedule, Squads, and Live Streaming

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

After suffering a 1-3 series loss against Australia, the Men in Blue will focus on limited-overs cricket as they host England for a T20 and ODI series before the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

  • The T20 series starts on January 22 at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.
  • The ODI series begins on February 6 at Vidarbha Cricket Association Stadium, Nagpur.
  • India is looking to regain momentum after losing six of their last eight Tests.
  • Key players like Jasprit Bumrah's participation remains uncertain.

Schedule:

item.title: ‘Aussie tactic to break skipper (Rohit Sharma) and make him anonymous empowers them and worked’ – Kerry O’Keefe - The Indian Express
item.description:
Aussie tactic to break skipper (Rohit Sharma) and make him anonymous empowers them and worked – Kerry O’Keefe

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Indian Express

Former Australian spinner Kerry O’Keeffe commented on the effectiveness of the Australian strategy to undermine the opposing captain, which contributed to Australia's 3-1 series victory over India.

  • Kerry O’Keefe highlights Australia's focus on targeting opposing captains.
  • Rohit Sharma, along with other recent targets, was effectively brought down by the Australian tactics.
  • Sharma's performance was notably poor, averaging just 6.2 over three Tests, the lowest for an opposing skipper.
  • O’Keeffe mentions past successes against other captains such as Shan Masood, Kraigg Brathwaite, and Tim Southee.
  • Rohit Sharma's low scoring and withdrawal from the final Test illustrates the effectiveness of the Australian ploy.
“If they can break the skipper and make him anonymous, it empowers them,” O’Keeffe noted.

This tactic appears to be a significant strategy in Australia's approach to cricket, as they aim to diminish the impact of high-profile players like Sharma and Kohli.

item.title: BCCI In A Fix Over Rohit Sharma-Virat Kohli Retirement Decision? Report Makes Huge Claim - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Faces Dilemma Over Retirement of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli

Published on: December 8, 2024 Source: NDTV

After a disappointing Test series against Australia, speculation grows around the future of star cricketers Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in the series, with a troubling average of 23.75.
  • Rohit managed just 31 runs in three matches before withdrawing from the last Test.
  • BCCI officials are reportedly unhappy with the players’ performances but face challenges in forcing them into retirement.
  • Selectors may have to make difficult choices for the team's future.
“The officials of the team are also unhappy with the defeat... BCCI cannot even ask them to retire, but something will have to be done for the team's betterment.”

The situation poses critical questions for India's cricketing future as the board considers its next steps regarding the legendary players.

item.title: Not Gill Or Pandya! 31-Year-Old Star Likely To Be India's Vice-Captain In Champions Trophy 2025 - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Set to be Vice-Captain for India in Champions Trophy 2025

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News18

India's cricket team is shifting focus to white-ball cricket after a Test series against Australia, with preparations underway for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, commencing February 19. Star fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah is likely to be named vice-captain if fitness allows.

  • India played a Test series against Australia, ending on January 5 with a 1-3 loss.
  • Upcoming matches include a T20I series against England starting January 22, followed by a three-match ODI series.
  • The Champions Trophy will be held in Dubai, with India not traveling to Pakistan for the event.
  • Bumrah led India in the first and fifth Tests of the recent series.
  • India's squad for the Champions Trophy is set to be announced by January 12.
“Bumrah is expected to serve as Rohit Sharma’s deputy if there are no major fitness concerns.”

India's squad choices will also consider the fitness of players like Mohammed Shami and others.

item.title: Ajit Agarkar to reveal India's Champions Trophy squad by January 12; Hardik, KL Rahul to be ignored for vice-captaincy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajit Agarkar to Reveal India's Champions Trophy Squad by January 12; Hardik, KL Rahul Ignored for Vice-Captaincy

January 06, 2025 - Hindustan Times

The focus for the Indian team will shift to white-ball cricket, with the ICC Champions Trophy set to begin on February 19. The squad announcement by Ajit Agarkar is expected by January 12.

  • India's recent Test calendar ended poorly, losing seven of their last eight matches.
  • The ICC Champions Trophy begins on February 19, with India scheduled to play England beforehand.
  • Ajit Agarkar will lead the selection committee for the squad announcement.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is likely to be named vice-captain, overlooking Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul.
"All teams need to submit their provisional squads by January 12 but allowed to make changes till February 13," said an ICC official.

The Indian cricket team is gearing up for a pivotal tournament as it seeks to rebound in the white-ball format after disappointing Test performances.

item.title: BPL 2024-2025: Match 9, SYL vs RAN Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BPL match between SYL vs RAN? - CricTracker
item.description:
BPL 2024-2025: Match 9 Prediction - Sylhet Strikers vs Rangpur Riders

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: CricTracker

The Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) continues with the Sylhet Strikers taking on the Rangpur Riders in match 9 of the tournament. The Riders are in exceptional form, having won all three of their previous matches.

  • The match takes place at Sylhet International Cricket Stadium.
  • Rangpur Riders currently sit atop the points table.
  • Sylhet Strikers are in last place after losing to Rangpur Riders earlier.
  • The pitch is expected to favor batsmen, possibly leading to a high-scoring game.
  • Predicted outcome favors Rangpur Riders to win.
“Rangpur Riders’ Saif Hassan has scored 106 runs in three games so far.”

Expectations are high for another performance from the Riders as they aim for their fourth consecutive win.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah to miss England white-ball series before Champions Trophy; BCCI yet to reveal grade of IND star's injury - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah to Miss England White-Ball Series Before Champions Trophy

Date: January 06, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah is set to miss the upcoming white-ball series against England due to an injury, with the grade of the injury yet to be ascertained.

  • Bumrah missed the final innings of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to a back injury.
  • The ODI series against England starts on February 6, before the Champions Trophy.
  • If Bumrah has a grade 2 injury, recovery might take up to six weeks.
  • Over the series, he bowled more than 150 overs, picking up 32 wickets, which may have contributed to his injury.
"If Bumrah’s injury is in grade 1 category, it will take a minimum of two to three weeks of rehabilitation before Return to Play (RTP)."

This decision to rest Bumrah is strategically aimed at ensuring he is fully fit for the Champions Trophy starting February 19.

item.title: Rohit Sharma has a future in stand-up comedy: Simon Katich - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rohit Sharma has a future in stand-up comedy: Simon Katich

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Former Australia cricketer Simon Katich humorously suggested that Rohit Sharma may have a promising future in stand-up comedy due to his compelling sense of humor displayed during interviews.

  • Simon Katich made comments regarding Rohit Sharma's performance and potential career after cricket.
  • Katich noted the difficulties Rohit may face during the upcoming tour in England.
  • Rohit reaffirmed his commitment to playing Test cricket despite recent challenges.
  • Discussion included Rohit's age and the physical demands of Test cricket.
“Those numbers are not for pretty reading. Test cricket isn’t a place for 37-year-olds at the top of the order.” - Simon Katich

Despite challenges, Rohit Sharma intends to continue playing Test cricket and is looking ahead to the next series against England in June.

item.title: Did India even deserve to qualify for the World Test Championship final? - The Times of India
item.description:
Did India Deserve to Qualify for the WTC Final?

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Times of India

India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia has raised questions about their qualification for the ICC World Test Championship (WTC) final set for June 2025. The article discusses the implications of their defeats, especially against New Zealand, and the team's overall performance.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series 1-3, missing qualification for the WTC final.
  • New Zealand recorded their first series win in India since 1955, ending India's 18-series winning streak at home.
  • The team struggled with spin and seam bowling, leading to their poor performance.
  • Key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli had underwhelming performances.
  • India faces a transition period, with upcoming opportunities for young talent.
“Yet, India's failure to qualify for the WTC final isn't the end of the world.”

This experience should help India regroup and refine their strategies for future competitions starting with their tour of England in June.

India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia has raised questions about their qualification for the ICC World Test Championship (WTC) final set for June 2025. item.title: 'Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was there. What happened suddenly?': Harbhajan Singh questions Ind - The Times of India
item.description:
Harbhajan Singh Questions India's Recent Struggles in Cricket

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh raises concerns about the national team’s recent performance, attributing the decline to changes after Rahul Dravid’s tenure as coach.

  • Harbhajan Singh expresses confusion over India's sudden struggles in cricket.
  • He highlights the success experienced during Rahul Dravid's time as coach.
  • Questions are raised about the team's strategies and player selections post-Dravid.
“Everything was fine till Rahul Dravid was there. What happened suddenly?” - Harbhajan Singh

The decline in performance has prompted discussions among fans and analysts about the future of Indian cricket.

item.title: India Suffer Big Jasprit Bumrah Blow Ahead Of England Series, Report Says Pacer To Miss... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Likely to Miss England Series Due to Back Injury

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss a significant portion of the upcoming white-ball series against England due to back spasms. The decision to rest him aims to ensure his recovery ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy starting February 19.

  • Bumrah was instrumental in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy, taking 32 wickets.
  • Concerns arise from his high workload during the series, where he bowled over 150 overs.
  • The BCCI medical team is assessing the severity of his injury to plan recovery.
  • If classified as a Grade 1 injury, Bumrah could be sidelined for 2-3 weeks, while Grade 2 could mean a 6-week recovery.
  • India is scheduled to face England in five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22.
“His presence is mandatory to India's fortunes,” sources say about Bumrah's role in the Champions Trophy.

The outcome of the injury assessment will determine Bumrah's participation in the series against England and his fitness for the upcoming matches.
